group_1.textCenter: (I should just go home...@I need to make dinner anyway.)

group_1.narration: We moved around a lot@when I was younger.
My dad's job took him all over.@Eventually he felt bad for making@me and my brother change schools@all the time, so he got a different,@more stable job.
He did all that for us, but nothing@made my life at school any better.@I felt bad.
Though it's not like I ever talked to them@about how things were going at school...
My dad makes less money at@his new job, so my mom had to@get a part-time job.
I don't want to worry them...@They're both working so hard for us.
I mean, it's fine. School is hell, but...@I've found a reason to live, at least.

group_1.textLeft: Hey, dinner's ready.@Come get it before it gets cold.

group_1.textRight: There's a TV show on at 10@that I wanna watch. Is that okay?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, that's fine. If there's something@else on at the same time I'll record it.
(Oh shoot...! I should get the@laundry out before I eat dinner...!)

group_1.textCenter: Phew...@That takes care of the laundry.
I'll watch a little something@before I get in the bath.

group_1.narration: "♪I don't have to look baby, I can@attract you with my telepathy!♪"

group_1.textCenter: I could watch it a million times@and still love it!

group_1.narration: Yep, idol groups always make my@stress melt away. Not the boy bands,@though. I'm into the girl groups.
I'm not alone, either. A lot of girls@are becoming fans of girl groups.

group_1.textCenter: (They're amazing...@Burning as bright as the sun...)

group_1.narration: I was hooked the second I came@across them singing while I was@flipping channels one night.
Their energy made the stage feel@like an entirely different universe.
They were having so much fun.@They put 110% into their songs and dances.
As soon as I started watching them,@my troubles just seemed to melt away.

group_1.textCenter: (Okay... I'll just watch one@music video before I head out.)

group_1.narration: Their lyrics were all positive, and@they all had such lovely voices.
They gave me the strength to carry on.
